about.title: About F.O.C.U.S.
about.description: F.O.C.U.S. (Following Ongoing Cues Under Structure) is a visual attention assessment designed for clinical and research settings.
about.focusDescription: The Following Ongoing Cues Under Structure (F.O.C.U.S.) is a computerized visual continuous performance test used to assess attention and inhibitory control. It is adapted from T.O.V.A. manual, which is widely used in the diagnosis and monitoring of attention disorders such as ADHD. F.O.C.U.S. is intended as a research tool to standardize the assessment of attention using an open-source platform.
about.focusMetrics: The test measures four key variables: Response Time, Response Time Variability, Commission Errors (false alarms), and Omission Errors (missed targets).
about.supportText: For technical support or questions about the F.O.C.U.S. Assessment, please contact your healthcare provider or system administrator.
